intro: Camelina subappressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf camelina, is a flowering plant native to northern North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Camelina subappressa is also noted for its potential as a biofuel crop due to its high oil content.
